Class InventoryManager

Object
InventoryManager
public class InventoryManager extends Object
The InventoryManager class provides a streamlined interface for managing inventory operations using the ReplenishmentService and PendingManagement interfaces.

This class supports common inventory management tasks such as viewing items, submitting replenishment requests, restocking items, handling pending requests, and checking stock levels. It integrates file operations through the dataReader and dataWriter utilities.

Example Usage:

 dataReader reader = new CsvFileReader();
 dataWriter writer = new CsvFileWriter();
 InventoryManagement inventoryManagement = new InventoryManagement(reader, writer);
 InventoryManager manager = new InventoryManager(inventoryManagement, inventoryManagement, reader, writer);

 manager.viewItems();
 manager.submitReplenishmentRequest("Paracetamol", 50, "Admin001");
 boolean restocked = manager.restockItemByName("Ibuprofen", 30);
 System.out.println("Restocked: " + restocked);

  • Constructor Details

    • InventoryManager

      public InventoryManager(ReplenishmentService replenishmentService, PendingManagement pendingManagement, dataReader dataReader, dataWriter dataWriter)
      Constructs an InventoryManager with the specified service interfaces and file processing utilities.
      Parameters:
      replenishmentService - An instance of ReplenishmentService to handle replenishment tasks.
      pendingManagement - An instance of PendingManagement to manage pending requests.
      dataReader - A dataReader instance for reading inventory data.
      dataWriter - A dataWriter instance for writing inventory data.

  • Method Details

    • viewItems

      public void viewItems()
      Displays all items in the inventory by using the ReplenishmentService.viewItems() method.

    • submitReplenishmentRequest

      public void submitReplenishmentRequest(String itemName, int quantity, String requestedBy)
      Submits a replenishment request for an item through the ReplenishmentService.submitReplenishmentRequest(String, int, String) method.
      Parameters:
      itemName - The name of the item to replenish.
      quantity - The quantity to request.
      requestedBy - The ID of the individual submitting the request.

    • updateLowStockThreshold

      public void updateLowStockThreshold(String itemName, int newThreshold)
      Updates the low stock threshold for an item using ReplenishmentService.updateLowStockThreshold(String, int).
      Parameters:
      itemName - The name of the item.
      newThreshold - The new threshold value.

    • restockItemByName

      public boolean restockItemByName(String itemName, int quantity)
      Restocks an item by its name using ReplenishmentService.restockItemByName(String, int).
      Parameters:
      itemName - The name of the item to restock.
      quantity - The quantity to add.
      Returns:
      true if the restocking was successful; false otherwise.

    • restockItemByRequestID

      public boolean restockItemByRequestID(String requestId, String approvedBy)
      Restocks an item using its request ID with ReplenishmentService.restockItemByRequestID(String, String).
      Parameters:
      requestId - The ID of the replenishment request.
      approvedBy - The ID of the individual approving the request.
      Returns:
      true if the restocking was successful; false otherwise.

    • viewPendingItems

      public void viewPendingItems()
      Displays all pending replenishment requests using PendingManagement.viewPendingItems().

    • handleAllPending

      public void handleAllPending(String approvedBy)
      Processes all pending replenishment requests using PendingManagement.handleAllPending(String).
      Parameters:
      approvedBy - The ID of the individual approving the requests.

    • checkLowStockForItem

      public void checkLowStockForItem(String itemName)
      Checks whether a specific item is below its low stock threshold.
      Parameters:
      itemName - The name of the item to check.

    • getStockLevel

      public int getStockLevel(String medicineName)
      Retrieves the current stock level of a specific item.
      Parameters:
      medicineName - The name of the item to retrieve the stock level for.
      Returns:
      The current stock quantity of the specified item.
